fields.description: Version of the endpoint agent or sensor running on the machine

fields.name: OSArchitecture
fields.description: Architecture of the operating system running on the machine

fields.description: Platform of the operating system running on the machine. This indicates specific operating systems, including variations within the same family, such as Windows 11, Windows 10 and Windows 7.

fields.description: Build version of the operating system running on the machine

fields.description: Machine tag added through the registry

fields.name: MachineGroup
fields.description: Machine group of the machine. This group is used by role-based access control to determine access to the machine

fields.name: ReportId
fields.description: Event identifier based on a repeating counter. To identify unique events, this column must be used in conjunction with the DeviceName and Timestamp columns

fields.name: OnboardingStatus
fields.description: Indicates whether the device is currently onboarded or not to Microsoft Defender for Endpoint or if the device is not supported

fields.name: AdditionalFields
fields.description: Additional information about the event in JSON array format

fields.name: DeviceCategory
fields.description: Broader classification that groups certain device types under the following categories: Endpoint, Network device, IoT, Unknown

fields.name: DeviceType
fields.description: Type of device based on purpose and functionality, such as network device, workstation, server, mobile, gaming console, or printer

fields.name: DeviceSubtype
fields.description: Additional modifier for certain types of devices, for example, a mobile device can be a tablet or a smartphone; only available if device discovery finds enough information about this attribute

fields.name: Model
fields.description: Model name or number of the product from the vendor or manufacturer, only available if device discovery finds enough information about this attribute

fields.name: Vendor
fields.description: Name of the product vendor or manufacturer, only available if device discovery finds enough information about this attribute

fields.name: OSDistribution
fields.description: Distribution of the OS platform, such as Ubuntu or RedHat for Linux platforms

fields.name: OSVersionInfo
fields.description: Additional information about the OS version, such as the popular name, code name, or version number

fields.name: MergedDeviceIds
fields.description: Previous device IDs that have been assigned to the same device

fields.name: MergedToDeviceId
fields.description: The most recent device ID assigned to a device

fields.name: SensorHealthState
fields.description: Indicates health of the device’s EDR sensor, if onboarded to Microsoft Defender For Endpoint

fields.name: IsExcluded
fields.description: Determines if the device is currently excluded from Microsoft Defender for Vulnerability Management experiences

fields.name: ExclusionReason
fields.description: Indicates the reason for device exclusion

fields.name: AssetValue
fields.description: Indicates the value of a device as assigned by the user

fields.name: ExposureLevel
fields.description: Indicates the exposure level of a device

fields.name: ConfigurationId
fields.description: Unique identifier for a specific configuration

fields.name: ConfigurationImpact
fields.description: Rated impact of the configuration to the overall configuration score (1-10)

fields.name: ConfigurationName
fields.description: Display name of the configuration

fields.name: ConfigurationDescription
fields.description: Description of the configuration

fields.name: RiskDescription
fields.description: Description of the associated risk

fields.name: ConfigurationCategory
fields.description: Category or grouping to which the configuration belongs: Application, OS, Network, Accounts, Security controls

fields.name: ConfigurationSubcategory
fields.description: Subcategory or subgrouping to which the configuration belongs. In many cases, this describes specific capabilities or features.

fields.name: ConfigurationBenchmarks
fields.description: List of industry benchmarks recommending the same or similar configuration

fields.name: Tags
fields.description: Labels representing various attributes used to identify or categorize a security configuration

fields.name: RemediationOptions
fields.description: Recommended actions to reduce or address any associated risks

For spam, this column shows the spam confidence level (SCL), indicating if the email was skipped (-1), found to be not spam (0,1), found to be spam with moderate confidence (5,6), or found to be spam with high confidence (9). For phishing, this column displays whether the confidence level is "High" or "Low".
